div1.p: Hench agrees to collaborate with Kean.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, September 9, 1939
div1.opener:
Yellow fever
September 9, 1939
Mr. John J. Moran
c/o Cia Sunoco de Cuba, S. A.
Avenida Menocal Nos. 455-57
Habana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
I am delighted with your nice long letter and
particularly pleased that you wrote to General Kean. I shall
be interested to know of his reaction and should be delighted
to collaborate with him. If, however, General Kean prefers
to write an article himself, this is, of course, his entire
privilege, and I will be very pleased to see him do so. It
would not disturb me in the least. Two papers on the subject,
giving as correct a version as possible, will be all the
more to the good.

I will let you know more about my plans to
visit Florida and Havana in late February or March, and I
am delighted to know that you plan to be there.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
